issue_place_s: New Hampshire, United States of America
issue_obverse_legend_s: STATE OF NEW-HAMPSHIRE | Seven Dollars. | THE Possessor of this BILL shall be paid SEVEN Spanish milled DOLLARS by the Thirty-first Day of December, One Thousand Seven Hundred and Eighty-six, with Interest in like Money, at the Rate of Five per Centum per Annum, by the State of NEW-HAMPSHIRE, according to an Act of the Legislature of the said State, of the Twenty-ninth Day of April, 1780.
issue_reverse_figure_description_s: Seal of severe storm at sea with motto SERENABIT (It will be calm).
issue_reverse_legend_s: THE UNITED STATES | SEVEN DOLLARS | Printed by HALL and SELLERS. | THE UNITED STATES ensure the Payment of the within BILL, and will draw Bills of Exchange for the Interest annually, if demanded, according to a Resolution of CONGRESS, of the 18th of March, 1780.
